entry.title: Building a Custom Stock/Requirements Report in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
Introduction

In SAP Materials Management, the Stock or Requirements List MD04 is one of the most frequently used transactions for planners and production teams. It provides a real-time view of current stock, incoming receipts, and outgoing requirements for a material at plant level. However, in real project scenarios, users often need a simplified, customized, or report-based version of MD04 that can be enhanced further or adapted to specific business needs.

 

During one such requirement, I worked on building a custom ABAP report that replicates the core functionality of MD04 while keeping the logic transparent and flexible. This blog explains how a custom Stock/Requirements Report can be built using standard SAP tables and function modules, without modifying standard SAP transactions.

Solution Review :

The custom report ZSTCOK_912 is designed to display stock and MRP elements for a given Material and Plant, closely mirroring the MD04 output.

1. Selection Screen

  • The report starts with a simple and user friendly selection screen:
  • Material Number MATNR
  • Plant WERKS
  • Both parameters are mandatory to ensure accurate stock evaluation.

2. Material Number Conversion

Since SAP stores material numbers with leading zeros, the report uses:

  1. CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT

This ensures the material number is in the correct internal format before database access.

3. Current Stock Determination

To calculate the opening balance:

  1. Table MARD is read
  2. All unrestricted stock LABST across storage locations is summed
  3. This provides the current physical stock, which becomes the starting available quantity.

4. Fetching Stock or Requirements Data

The core of the solution uses the standard SAP function module:

MD_STOCK_REQUIREMENTS_LIST_API

  • This is the same API used by MD04 and returns:
  • MRP elements  receipts and requirements 
  • Quantities
  • Planning and control data
  • The data is stored in internal tables such as MDPSX, MDEZX, and MDSUX.

5. Display Logic and Running Stock Calculation

  • Each MRP element is processed sequentially:
  • Receipts increase available stock
  • Requirements reduce available stock
  • A running available quantity is calculated and displayed line by line, giving users a projected stock position over time.

6. Output Format

The report displays:

  • Date
  • MRP element type  Receipt, Requirement, Dependent Requirement, etc.
  • Document number
  • Receipt quantity
  • Projected available stock
  • Additionally, summary information such as total records processed and current stock is displayed at the end.

The Complete Solution Code

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Report ZSTCOK_912
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& Custom Stock/Requirements  Report
*& Purpose: Display stock and requirements similar to MD04 transaction
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
REPORT ZSTCOK_912.

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& DATA DECLARATIONS
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*

" Reference to standard SAP tables for material master data
TABLES: mara, " General Material Data
marc. " Plant Data for Material

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& SELECTION SCREEN
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
" Input parameters for the report - both are mandatory
SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK b1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-001.
PARAMETERS: p_matnr TYPE matnr OBLIGATORY, " Material Number
p_werks TYPE werks_d OBLIGATORY. " Plant
SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK b1.

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& INTERNAL TABLES AND WORK AREAS
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*

" Internal tables to store data returned by the function module
DATA: gt_mdpsx TYPE TABLE OF mdps, " MRP element data (dates, doc numbers)
gs_mdpsx TYPE mdps, " Work area for MDPSX
gt_mdezx TYPE TABLE OF mdez, " MRP element quantities
gs_mdezx TYPE mdez, " Work area for MDEZX
gt_mdsux TYPE TABLE OF mdsu, " Summary data
gs_mdsux TYPE mdsu. " Work area for MDSUX

" Structures for exporting parameters from function module
DATA: gs_mt61d TYPE mt61d, " Material requirements planning data
gs_mdkp TYPE mdkp, " MRP controller and configuration
gs_cm61m TYPE cm61m, " MRP list control data
gs_mdsta TYPE mdsta, " MRP statistics
gv_ergbz TYPE ergbz. " Result indicator

" Variables for processing and display
DATA: gv_labst TYPE labst, " Unrestricted stock quantity
gv_available TYPE labst, " Available quantity (opening stock)
lv_running_stock TYPE mng01, " Running available stock
lv_matnr TYPE matnr, " Material number with leading zeros
lv_txt TYPE char30, " Text for MRP element description
lv_count TYPE i. " Counter for total records

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& START-OF-SELECTION
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
START-OF-SELECTION.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 1: Convert Material Number with Leading Zeros
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" SAP stores material numbers with leading zeros in database
" This conversion ensures proper format for database queries
CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
EXPORTING
input = p_matnr
IMPORTING
output = lv_matnr.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 2: Get Current Stock from MARD Table
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" MARD contains storage location data for materials
" We sum all unrestricted stock (LABST) across storage locations
SELECT SINGLE SUM( labst )
INTO gv_labst
FROM mard
WHERE matnr = lv_matnr
AND werks = p_werks.

" Initialize available quantity based on query result
IF sy-subrc = 0.
gv_available = gv_labst. " Stock found
ELSE.
gv_available = 0. " No stock found
ENDIF.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 3: Call Function Module to Get Stock Requirements List
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" MD_STOCK_REQUIREMENTS_LIST_API is SAP standard FM used by MD04
" It returns all MRP elements (receipts and requirements)
CALL FUNCTION 'MD_STOCK_REQUIREMENTS_LIST_API'
EXPORTING
matnr = lv_matnr " Material number
werks = p_werks " Plant
IMPORTING
e_mt61d = gs_mt61d " Planning data
e_mdkp = gs_mdkp " MRP configuration
e_cm61m = gs_cm61m " Control data
e_mdsta = gs_mdsta " Statistics
e_ergbz = gv_ergbz " Result indicator
TABLES
mdpsx = gt_mdpsx " MRP element master data
mdezx = gt_mdezx " MRP element quantities
mdsux = gt_mdsux " Summary data
EXCEPTIONS
material_plant_not_found = 1 " Material doesn't exist
plant_not_found = 2 " Plant doesn't exist
OTHERS = 3. " Other errors

" Error handling for function module call
IF sy-subrc <> 0.
WRITE: / 'Error getting stock requirements data'.
WRITE: / 'Return Code:', sy-subrc.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

" Check if any data was returned
IF gt_mdpsx IS INITIAL AND gt_mdezx IS INITIAL.
WRITE: / 'No stock requirements data found for Material:', p_matnr,
'Plant:', p_werks.
EXIT.
ENDIF.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 4: Display Report Header Information
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
WRITE: / 'Stock/Requirements List as of', sy-datum, sy-uzeit.
WRITE: / sy-uline(155).
WRITE: / 'Material:', p_matnr, ' Plant:', p_werks.
WRITE: / sy-uline(155).
SKIP 1.

" Display MRP configuration details if available
IF gs_mdkp IS NOT INITIAL.
WRITE: / 'MRP Controller:', gs_mdkp-dispo. " Person responsible
WRITE: / 'MRP Type:', gs_mdkp-dismm. " Planning strategy
WRITE: / 'Lot Size:', gs_mdkp-disls. " Lot sizing procedure
SKIP 1.
ENDIF.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 5: Display Column Headers
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" Column positions are carefully aligned for readability
WRITE: / 'Date', " Date of MRP element
15 'MRP Element data', " Type of element (receipt/requirement)
45 'Doc Number', " Document number reference
70 'Receipt Qty', " Quantity of receipt
90 'Available Qty'. " Running available stock
WRITE: / sy-uline(155).

" Initialize running stock with opening balance
lv_running_stock = gv_available.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 6: Display Opening Stock
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" Show current available stock as starting point
WRITE: / sy-datum USING EDIT MASK '__/______', " Today's date formatted
90 gv_available. " Opening stock quantity
WRITE: / sy-uline(155).

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 7: Process and Display MRP Elements
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
" Loop through all MRP elements (receipts and requirements)
LOOP AT gt_mdpsx INTO gs_mdpsx.

" Get corresponding quantity data for this MRP element
" Match by date (dat00) and planning number (plumi)
READ TABLE gt_mdezx INTO gs_mdezx
WITH KEY dat00 = gs_mdpsx-dat00
plumi = gs_mdpsx-plumi.

IF sy-subrc = 0.

"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Determine MRP Element Type Description
"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
" DELKZ field indicates whether element is receipt or requirement
CASE gs_mdpsx-delkz.
WHEN 'V'.
lv_txt = 'Receipt'. " Incoming material
WHEN 'B'.
lv_txt = 'Requirement'. " Outgoing material demand
WHEN 'L'.
lv_txt = 'Delivery Schedule'. " Scheduled delivery
WHEN 'A'.
lv_txt = 'Dependent Reqmt'. " From BOM explosion
WHEN 'U'.
lv_txt = 'Stock Transfer'. " Between storage locations
WHEN OTHERS.
lv_txt = gs_mdpsx-delkz. " Display code if unknown
ENDCASE.

"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Calculate Running Available Stock
"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
" Receipts (+) increase stock, Requirements (-) decrease stock
IF gs_mdpsx-delkz = 'V'.
" Receipt: Add to available stock
lv_running_stock = lv_running_stock + gs_mdezx-mng03.
ELSE.
" Requirement: Subtract from available stock
lv_running_stock = lv_running_stock - gs_mdezx-mng02.
ENDIF.

"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Display MRP Element Line
"*----------------------------------------------------------------*
" Show each element with aligned columns
WRITE: / gs_mdpsx-dat00 USING EDIT MASK '__/______', " Date formatted
15 lv_txt, " Element type description
45 gs_mdpsx-delnr, " Document number
70 gs_mdezx-mng03, " Receipt quantity
90 lv_running_stock. " Projected available stock

" Increment record counter
lv_count = lv_count + 1.

ENDIF.

ENDLOOP.

"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
"* Step 8: Display Summary Information
"*------------------------------------------------------------------*
WRITE: / sy-uline(155).
SKIP 1.

" Show total number of MRP elements processed
WRITE: / 'Total Records:', lv_count.
" Show current physical stock
WRITE: / 'Current Stock:', gv_labst.

" Display summary data count if available
IF gt_mdsux IS NOT INITIAL.
SKIP 2.
WRITE: / 'Summary Data Available - Total Entries:', lines( gt_mdsux ).
ENDIF.

*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*& END OF REPORT
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*

Output  for standard MD04  real stock view:

Output for custom Report output:

 

Conclusion :

This custom ABAP report demonstrates how standard SAP functionality like MD04 can be replicated and customized using clean ABAP logic and standard APIs. By leveraging MD_STOCK_REQUIREMENTS_LIST_API and combining it with stock data from MARD, the report provides a clear and reliable view of stock movements and future requirements.

From my experience, building such custom reports not only helps meet specific business requirements but also improves understanding of SAP‚Äôs internal MRP data flow. This approach offers flexibility for further enhancements such as ALV output, additional filters, or integration with planning dashboards, making it a practical alternative to standard transactions when customization is required.

Thanks for Reading My Blog..

ABAP Connectivity 

SAP BTP ABAP environment .

entry.title: Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Release ‚Äì What‚Äôs New
entry.content:
Core Function 

Enablement of Additional End-to-End Processes 

Following our Suite-First strategy, we consider it essential that Warehouse Management works with all scope items and process variations that are available within SAP ‚Äì and as you might know, that is quite a lot. Therefore, I am happy to share that with this release we were able to release the enablement of six (!) additional end-to-end processes: 

  • Stock transfer with delivery (BME) in combination with transportation management 
    • Intercompany stock transfer returns (2TS) 
      • Intracompany stock transfer returns 
        • Customer returns for sales kits (5CX) 
          • In-house repair (3XK) - Send back to customer 
            • Just-in-time supply to customer (2EM) - Summarized JIT calls 

              For all of these, the respective delivery can now be distributed to and processed in Warehouse Management. The selection of the delivery via the according reference documents is enabled, e.g. to select an outbound delivery based on the JIT reference. You‚Äôll find more details on each of these in the linked What‚Äôs New presentation. 

              Stock Removal Strategy for Direct Goods Movement Postings

              In my view, this innovation is quite special, because it is different from the classical paradigm to always go via warehouse tasks when removing stock. Some customers asked for a very simplified way of posting the consumption for the components of their production orders. Instead of using one of the production integration patterns where you first stage the components to the production supply area and then post the consumption from there, the staging and consumption is done in just one step. This is achieved, by posting the consumption directly from the storage bin in the warehouse. The operator is then responsible to physically remove it from there and hand it over to production, but from a system perspective the stock is already consumed. To simplify this process, we have introduced a new button in the app ‚ÄúPost Goods Movement‚Äù, to run the stock determination and to thereby propose the storage bin from which the consumption can be posted.



              Combined Picking in RF 

              This feature has already been very popular in Private Cloud EWM and has now been asked for by many of our Public Cloud customers. The scenario is to have multiple outbound deliveries, all requesting the same product. A typical scenario would be e-commerce where many different end customers have ordered one piece of a certain product. Since a picking warehouse task is always created per outbound delivery order item, this would mean in this scenario, that multiple picking warehouse tasks are created, all requesting one piece of the same product from the same storage bin. Obviously, confirming those in RF on the mobile handheld device one-by-one is quite cumbersome for the warehouse operative and very inefficient. With this innovation, those quantities are now combined, summed up and displayed as just one pick in RF, while in the background, it is still individual warehouse tasks. To prevent a day-one impact, this feature must be activated in the configuration. 


               Updating Media

              Migration Object: Assign Storage Bin to Production Supply Area   

              Even though this innovation is ‚Äújust‚Äù a migration object, I am convinced that it is very important to many customers. When working with the Advanced Production Integration, it is mandatory to maintain the assignment of storage bins to the production supply area, including the staging behaviour for individual products. As some of our customers have thousands of products to be maintained here, it is essential that this maintenance can be simplified with a migration object.

              Compare Stock with Inventory Management 

              When using Warehouse Management, the stock is managed in the warehouse on individual storage bins, but the stock is also still managed in Inventory Management on storage location level. Warehouse Management is then the leading system in terms of stock management. All stock postings are done in Warehouse Management, but they always update Inventory Management. Therefore, the stock balance in Warehouse Management and Inventory Management is always in sync. In rare cases it can happen that deviations occur, for example because of rounding issues. Worst case, this can then lead to an error when trying to update Inventory Management from Warehouse Management. Therefore, we have released a new app to compare the stock in Warehouse Management with Inventory Management. If there are any differences, then this app allows to immediately correct these differences with an additional stock posting, correcting the stock in Inventory Management. 

              Extensibility 

              New CDS Views 

              Same as with the last releases, we have again shipped additional CDS views, allowing customers to access the data they need to build their extensions. 

              There is a new CDS view to access the storage bin data, thereby making one of the most central objects available. In addition, there are new CDS views available in the area of wave management, providing access to wave headers and wave items but also to settings such as wave templates and wave types. 

               

              Integration 

              Additions to the Warehouse Order and Task API 

              With the Warehouse Order and Task API being one of the most central APIs in Warehouse Management, it has received some additions in this release: 

              • Merging multiple warehouse orders into one warehouse order 
                • Splitting warehouse tasks from an existing warehouse order 
                  • A new parameter to prevent the full handling unit withdrawal during the confirmation of product warehouse tasks.

                    Additions to the Storage Bin API 

                    The Storage Bin API had been a read-only API so far but has now been enhanced with the following: 

                    • Create storage bins 
                      • Update storage bins 
                        • Action to block storage bins 
                          • Action to unblock storage bins 

                            FIND OUT MORE! 

                            This blog only pointed out some of the highlights of this release ‚Äì you can find the full list of innovations in the What‚Äôs New presentation.

entry.title: Integration of SAP Emarsys with Snowflake Database for RDS Segmentation and Personalization
entry.content:
Overview

Integrating Snowflake with SAP Emarsys enables marketers to leverage external data for advanced segmentation and personalization without duplicating data. This is achieved through SAP Emarsys' Relational Data Service (RDS), which connects to client-hosted databases like Snowflake.

In this blog we‚Äôll walk through the process of setting up a Snowflake trial account, creating a sample database table, and integrating it with SAP Emarsys to enable RDS-based segmentation.

Setting Up Snowflake Trail Account:

Sign up for a Snowflake trial by visiting the official Snowflake website, providing your details, and activating your account via the email link. Once activated, log in to access your Snowflake dashboard.

Setting Up Snowflake connection in Emarsys

Step 1: Login to your Emarsys account and go to Add-ons -> Relational Data.

Step 2: Under connections tab click on "Create Connections" and then select Snowflake from the list of connection types.

Step 3: Now we'll have to add the Snowflake account details. To get the Account Name go to your Snowflake account and select your profile on the bottom-left section. Click on "Account" -> "View Account Details".

You will find the Account Name as highlighted below. 

Step 4: For the further details click on "Query Data" on Snowflake home page.

From the Databases dropdown list Select "SNOWFLAKE_LEARNING_DB" and select schema "PUBLIC" and on the same page on the top-right you will find the warehouse name "COMPUTE_WH". Add these details in Emarsys.

Step 5: In Emarsys give the username and password same as the ones that you have created at the time of Snowflake account setup. Finally save and click on "Test". You'll get the message the connection is successful.

Creating Database Table in Snowflake

Step 1: Click on "Query Data" on Snowflake home page. And select the database "SNOWFLAKE_LEARNING_DB" and schema "PUBLIC" as mentioned before.

Run an SQL query to create a table and insert values into the table.

Step 2: Now In Emarsys, go to Add- Ons->Relational Data->Tables & Views search for the table that we have created and click on Personalization settings

Under the reference field, you'll have to select the database field with which you want to link your contacts in Emarsys. Here I'm selecting "Email" as my refence field and then click on "Save field configuration".

Your table is now available and ready to use in Emarsys for creating segments.

Creating Relational Segments in Emarsys:

Sample Use Case: Here we are creating a segment to identify contracts from the DEMO table that are ending within a specified number of upcoming days, so that we can communicate them before contract expiration.

Step 1: In Emarsys, go to Add- Ons->Relational Data->Segment Templates and click on "Create Segment Templates".

Step 2: Give the name of the Segment template. Now under segment template definition click on "Create Parameter". Give the name of the parameter as "number_of_days" and select parameter type as number input.

Step 3: Give the segment template definition and SQL query as below. While writing the SQL query, drag and drop the parameter that we have created to place it in the SQL query. 

Map the contact reference field and the database reference fields as "Email".

Step 4: To test the SQL query, under "Preview and test" enter a number and click on Run.

You'll get a few contract details with end date with in the next 90 days.

Step 5: Now to create the Relational Segment using the above segment template, go to Contacts->Segments and click on Create Segment->Standard segment->Relational Segment.

Step 6: Give the name of the segment. Under Template, select the template that we have created from the drop-down list. Enter the number 90 in the segment definition and click on save & apply.

The segment result will show the total number of contacts matching the given criteria.

Relational Data Personalization Tokens:

To use business-specific data stored in the relational databases to personalize campaigns across channels we need to create Relational Data Personalization Tokens. They are placeholders in your content that dynamically pull values from relational tables connected to Emarsys.

Step 1: Go to Content->Personalization and click on "Create Token" and select "Relational Data"

Step 2: Give the token name, here we are creating token for contact ID and below Relational data preset click on "New".

Give the name of your preset, select connection as Snowflake, select the table DEMO and under Set Parameters select type as contact field, value as Email.

Step 3: Now select the data preset that we have created and under "Field" you'll get all the database fields of the table DEMO, from the drop-down select Contract ID and click on Save.

Step 4: Once the token is created it will be available while creating the campaigns under personalization section.

In this way we can setup and configure Relational Databases in Emarsys and utilize the external data without actually storing the data in Emarsys.

I hope you found this blog helpful.

Regards,

Swetha.

entry.title: Re: SSAM vs. SAP FSM Mobile Application ‚Äì Scope Clarifica...
entry.content:
Hi,

Yes there is a different setup and steps needed when using SSAM in conjunction with FSM (instead of FSM mobile).

Syam has a blog with further help.sap.com links here, I would recommend starting by reading this: Integration of SAP Service and Asset Manager (SSAM) with SAP Field Service Management (FSM) using the FSM Cloud Connector (proaxia) 

The steps also differ depending on whether you are:

a) Using the Proaxia connector or SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) for the integration.

b) What type of Persona/Roles you are trying to integrate (i.e. Field Service Technician vs Maintenance Technician)

Regards,

Tim

entry.title: Make SAP change faster, safer, and smarter with continuous delivery and DevOps
entry.content:
Delivering updates, fixes, and new functionality quickly, can be a headache for SAP teams. Business requirements keep shifting and teams need to adapt to those new demands just as fast. If you don‚Äôt, you risk falling behind in efficiency, innovation, and customer expectations.

A way forward that‚Äôs proven to work is to move away from large, infrequent releases and deliver changes in smaller chunks. Many SAP teams are already doing this, switching from quarterly deployments to weekly updates, for example.

The benefits of this are obvious: faster delivery, less risk, and far more opportunities to respond to real-time business feedback.

But adopting this agile model isn‚Äôt always easy, especially if you are considering or are in the middle of an S/4HANA migration or moving to the Cloud. It requires a shift in mindset, a new way of managing SAP change, and the right automation to support it.

Continuous delivery and DevOps: The foundation for faster SAP change

The idea is to deliver smaller, manageable updates that are ready to be deployed at any moment, with minimal risk. Adopting this continuous delivery approach means you can deploy enhancements and fixes when the business needs them, rather than waiting for next pre-planned change window.

DevOps complements this by breaking down silos between development and operations ‚Äì the barriers that all too often slow down SAP change.

Together, continuous delivery and DevOps enable:

  • Faster time to value: changes get deployed more quickly and frequently
  • Reduced risk: errors get caught earlier, minimizing unscheduled downtime
  • Better collaboration between technical and business teams, allowing a rapid response when priorities change

Continuous delivery is the how and DevOps is the culture and the mindset that makes it possible.

Why the traditional approach to SAP change delivery falls short

Many SAP organizations still rely on the classic waterfall approach: gather requirements, design, develop, test, and deploy ‚Äì during a planned outage, of course.

But this is a slow and inflexible way of working that just won‚Äôt cut it in a fast-changing world where business needs continually change.

The problems are real and include:

  • Slow delivery cycles: With a waterfall approach, each phase of a project must be finished before the next can begin. This results in lengthy timelines that can't keep pace with the demands for rapid updates and continuous iteration
  • Increasing landscape complexity: Today‚Äôs SAP landscapes can span on-premises, Cloud and hybrid environments, making change control so much more complicated
  • Resistance to change: Established processes and the familiarity with doing things the way they‚Äôve always been done can make teams resistant to new ways of working

Bridging the Gap Between Old and New
Adopting DevOps and continuous delivery isn‚Äôt about abandoning governance or established change processes. Structured approval gates, risk controls, and audit trails of every change, still have a role to play.

What gets transformed is how change is managed across your SAP landscape, so teams can accelerate delivery while minimizing risk.

In practice this means:

  • Breaking down silos between teams: getting development, operations and business teams working together
  • Standardizing and documenting change processes
  • Establishing a central repository for details related to any ITSM tickets, testing cases and results, and code review confirmation

The Role of Automation in Making It Work
Automation is the foundation that supports DevOps and continuous delivery in SAP. The closer you get to these goals, the more important it is to get rid of manual, error-prone steps from the change process.

An automated, unified platform integrating ALM tools gives you the DevOps results you‚Äôre after:

  • More frequent, reliable, and cost-effective SAP change
  • Keeping the right people informed and accountable
  • End-to-end control and traceability of your SAP change workflow

Success relies on a workflow engine that integrates and orchestrates 3rd-party solutions, reducing the time and effort to deploy and maintain SAP applications over their lifetime. You can build a DevOps workflow from the request for change to production deployment. This unified toolchain can be as straightforward or as complex as your organization requires.

Why modernizing SAP change matters
Adopting a DevOps methodology in SAP is not always easy ‚Äì but it‚Äôs not impossible either. You can transform how you manage change across your SAP landscape to achieve continuous delivery and DevOps goals ‚Äì even if there is no one-size-fits all solution.

Organizations must adapt and evolve SAP change processes to what works best for them. The payoff is significant, though ‚Äì with faster, safer, and more efficient SAP change, you‚Äôll enjoy minimum downtime, be able to quickly respond to market demands, and ensure better alignment between IT and business stakeholders.

Being able to respond quickly and confidently is not just an operational improvement ‚Äì it gives your organization a massive competitive edge.

Whatever your DevOps strategy, a workflow engine that integrates and orchestrates a unified toolchain is necessary to meet your objectives.

entry.title: Error while binding cloud logging service to application
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have an application deployed in sap btp using cloud foundry, and an instance of cloud logging service. My application is built in java using spring boot. I am trying to bind tht application to the cloud logging service using manifest.yml file. But doing so I am getting an error "Error: Server error, status code: 400, error code: 10001, message: This service plan requires client support for asynchronous service operation". (Other services are getting binded to application without any problem.) When i searched i found that this error might come as a result of using older cf cli version. Currently I am using v7.9.0.

My what can be the possible solution for this problem? If I upgrade cf cli to v8.9.0 will it work? Or is there some other reason i am facing this problem.

entry.title: Re: Introductory Guide to Provisioning of SAP Business Data Cloud

entry.title: Key Apps for GSTR-6 and ISD Management: India
entry.content:
This blog provides a summary of the apps and their functions required to file GSTR-6 in SAP S/4HANA Cloud (formerly known as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition).

GSTR-6 is the mandatory monthly return for an Input Service Distributor (ISD),  a critical compliance piece for large enterprises with centralized procurement, such as software companies with multiple offices under the same PAN. The ISD mechanism allows the Head Office to receive input service invoices (like consulting or software licenses) centrally and then distribute the associated Input Tax Credit (ITC) to the unit locations where the services are actually consumed.

The SAP S/4HANA system manages this distribution automatically through ISD program known as J1IG_ISDN . It calculates how much of the total ITC each branch should get. This calculation is usually based on a fair measure, like the turnover (sales) of each branch relative to the others and maintained in configuration settings.

SAP generates special internal documents (ISD invoices) that formally transfer the tax credit to each branch. This allows the individual branches to legally reduce their own tax bill by the credit they received.

Here are the apps that assist users in creating ISD invoices and filing GSTR-6 returns:

  1. Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices
  2. eDocument Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents
  3. Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies
  4. Run Statuary Reports

              I.                  Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices:

    This app helps users to create, display and redistribute Input Service Distribution invoices. Users select the filter criteria like Company code, Fiscal Year, ISD Business Place and selection of documents based on posting date. Further, based on the selection, A processing action can be triggered to view the ISD distribution, Change ISD distribution or to Post ISD distribution and create ISD invoices.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Re-distribute and Create ISD Invoices

    App ID

    J1IG_ISDN

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GLO_GSTISD_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Input Service Distribution for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_PURCHASER_IN

    Business Role Description

    Purchaser for India

     

              II.                  EDOCUMENT Cockpit/ Manage Electronic Documents

    Users can use either eDocument Cockpit app or Manage Electronic Document App to work with electronic documents.

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Manage Electronic Documents

    App ID

    F4306

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    eDocument Cockpit

    App ID

    EDOC_COCKPIT

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDOC_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk

    eDocument cockpit app allows users to process electronic documents (eDocuments) that are created automatically based on source documents. Users can display eDocuments, submit documents in XML to external systems and monitor the respective status for subsequent actions.

    What are the differences between the Manage Electronic Documents app and eDocument Cockpit app?

              III.                  Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies

    This is the app where users can review inconsistencies in the documents for example a document is available in GSTR-6A but missing in Book of accounts or if a document is missing in Tax authority but available in Book of accounts. Users then decide to accept the documents based on available info or may wait for the correction of the records. Only the accepted documents are picked by ISD distribution program. Please note this is the same action you will be navigated to 'Prepare ITC' action mentioned in following  step IV - Run Statuary Reports.

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Resolve Electronic Document Inconsistencies - India

    App ID

    F8406

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_SD_BC_GLO_EDC_IN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    Globalization - Electronic Documents Consistency for India

    Business Role

    SAP_BR_BILLING_CLERK_IN

    Business Role Description

    Billing Clerk for India

              IV.                  Run Statuary Reports

    This is the main App where GSTR-6 filing steps are performed. There are 5 actions/steps involved as shown below:

     

    App Name/ Launcher Title

    Run Statutory Reports

    App ID

    F1515

    Business Catalogue

    SAP_FIN_BC_GL_REPORTING_CN_PC

    Business Catalogue  Description

    General Ledger - Reporting for India

    Business Role

     

    Business Role Description

    General Ledger Accountant for India

    We have gone through the 4 important apps for GSTR-6 Filing. This concludes this blog for GSTR-6 Filing starting from ISD distribution to reconcile and file your returns.  Please ensure you have assigned the required business roles to locate these applications. Refer to Fiori Application Libary for latest information about catalogues, roles and spaces. Further resources can be accessed through SAP Help Portal:

    GSTR6 Report

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Tickin‚Äô Off the Policies (GRC Christmas tune)
entry.content:
Like decorating the Christmas tree, baking gingerbread cookies and waiting for Santa to arrive, our yearly GRC Christmas parody has now become a tradition.

Well, maybe not as famous as the other three, but getting there!

Another tradition of course is unwrapping presents‚Ä¶ which, for some younger ones, will inevitably be a building brick toy from a very famous Danish company. Did you know that the patent for the toy building brick was lodged in 1958 and that it is possible to combine six 2x4 bricks in 915.103.765 different ways? I don‚Äôt know about you but I surely stepped 915.103.765 times on Lego bricks hidden on the carpet!

Getting back to our topic today but staying in 1958 because it‚Äôs the time of the year to fully embrace nostalgia, this is also the year that Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree was released.

Our GRC Christmas tune will therefore be inspired by this all-time classic!

So, leave your Legos on the table (not on the carpet!) and join me in singing our 2025 Tickin‚Äô Off the Policies parody.

 

  

 

Background:

The day is Tuesday 16th of December 2025, our GRC lead is finalizing his compliance training and making sure that all controls are in place to run smoothly over the holidays to protect the organization and its business.

 

Tickin' off the policies

Before shutting my laptop

 

Data privacy‚Äôs the key

Wish I‚Äôd gone to the workshop

 

Year-end's near, finally

And vacation time coming

 

One last exception to deny

And I'll send the reporting

 

Can't wait for my audit lead to send me his cheer

When he sees no anomaly

We‚Äôll celebrate merrily!

 

Screen' all our 3rd party

Making sure they are okay

 

Checkin' blocked payments to prevent any delay

 

[üé∫ trumpets ]

 

There is just one last item I need to clear

 

IT checks for security

1st line users will be happy

 

Control testin' activity

Automated all the way

 

That's how GRC should be carried anyway!

 

[üé∫ trumpets ]

 

I hope you enjoyed this last GRC Tuesdays post of the year. Thank you for following us once again in 2025, reading, sharing and commenting on these blogs and I sincerely hope you will continue to do so in 2026.

As usual, if you‚Äôd like to get in touch, feel free to add a note on this blog.

Finally, in case you‚Äôd like to continue singing GRC Christmas tunes, below are links to our previous beats:

  • 2024 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: Last Christmas... I Wasn‚Äôt Exemplar! (GRC Christmas tune)
  • 2023 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: All I Want for Christmas is Cyber Safety
  • 2022 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: Let me know! Let us go! Take a bow!, a GRC Christmas miracle
  • 2021 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: The Famous GRC Christmas Carol version 2021
  • 2020 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: We Wish You a Threat-Free Christmas and a Breachless New Year
  • 2019 ‚Äì GRC Tuesdays: The Twelve Days of (GRC) Christmas

entry.title: Cross Container Access Issue : object_owner and application user
entry.content:
Hi Experts, 

   I am working on cross container access , there are two types of roles that we define with Producer Project , one for the object_owner Role# and one for the application_user Role. We have attribute called privileges_with_grant_options, as per my knowledge , this attribute states what kind of privileges can be offered by a object_owner to application_user . 

In my project I have mentioned "SELECT" in my privileges_with_grant_options for Role# and I have mentioned "SELECT" , "INSERT" under privileges for Role.

Object Owner Role 

{
    "role":{
        "name":"EXTERNAL_ACESS_READ_G#",
        "object_privileges": [
            {
                "name":"PRODUCERNAMESPACE_PRODUCT",
                "type": "TABLE",
              
                "privileges_with_grant_option":["SELECT"] 
            }
        ]
    }
}

 Application User role 

{
    "role":{
        "name":"EXTERNAL_ACESS_READ",
        "object_privileges": [
            {
                "name":"PRODUCERNAMESPACE_PRODUCT",
                "type": "TABLE",
                "privileges": [
                    "SELECT","INSERT"
                ]
        
            }
        ]
    }
}

As per my understanding , this it should throw an error when I execute cds deploy --to hana it should throw error , stating INSERT cant be granted as there is no INSERT in  privileges_with_grant_option. Adding further Iam able to post it from Consumer app  Iam able to Post . What is the difference object_owner(schema_owner) and application_user.

Git Hub Repositories

https://github.com/Subramaniyam507/CrossHDIContainerProducer

https://github.com/Subramaniyam507/CrossHdiContainerConsumer 

Please help me with my query.

Thank you

entry.title: SAP‚Äôs Golden Certificate as a Benchmark: KPN‚Äôs Commitment to Quality
entry.content:
SAP‚Äôs Golden Certificate has been awarded to our partner KPN B.V. following the certification of its SAP operations and services for the tenth consecutive time. This milestone reflects more than two decades of a continuous journey with SAP, driven by a strong commitment to quality, trust, and innovation. We deeply value our enduring partnership and appreciate KPN‚Äôs willingness to share their insights and experiences on how certification has played a central role in strengthening customer confidence and shaping KPN‚Äôs service portfolio. From early SAP HANA adoption to today‚Äôs cloud solutions such as SAP S/4HANA, RISE with SAP, and SAP BTP, KPN has continuously expanded its SAP capabilities.

 
Could you start by telling us about your company and the services you offer?

At KPN, we‚Äôre proud to be the Netherlands‚Äô leading provider of telecommunications and IT services. Our unique combination of a secure, nationwide network and privately owned data centers empowers us to deliver critical SAP environments for both national and international clients. For nearly 30 years, our dedicated SAP team has been at the forefront, offering expert consultancy, managed services, and 24/7 support. Our customers benefit from our proven track record and deep expertise, ensuring their SAP systems are secure, stable, and ready for the future. As cloud solutions like SAP BTP become increasingly vital, we guide our customers through every step of their digital transformation, acting as a trusted advisor and technical partner.

 

As an SAP partner for more than 24 years, how has your partnership evolved, and what have been the most significant milestones or highlights in your collaboration with SAP?

Our partnership with SAP is a story of continuous innovation and shared success. For over two decades, we‚Äôve been one of the most consistently certified SAP service providers in the Netherlands, a testament to our commitment and expertise. Highlights include our early adoption of SAP HANA, the integration of certified disaster recovery across multiple data centers, and our expansion into SAP Cloud services. Each achievement has enabled our customers to innovate with confidence and resilience. Our recent certification as an SAP BTP Operations Partner marks another proud milestone, reflecting our dedication to supporting our customers‚Äô evolving needs. Looking ahead, we‚Äôre excited to deepen our expertise in SAP Cloud security and AI, ensuring our customers remain at the cutting edge.

 

What inspired your decision to seek your first service certification in 2001, and how do you assess that choice today?

Looking back, our decision to pursue SAP certification in 2001 was driven by a passion for excellence and a desire to earn our customers‚Äô trust. We recognized early on that independent validation was essential, not just for us, but for our customers‚Äô peace of mind. Today, we‚Äôre proud that this commitment continues to set us apart. Maintaining our certifications remains crucial, reassuring our customers, strengthening our reputation, and often making the difference in competitive bids. This commitment to quality and trust forms the foundation of our success, and we value the confidence it brings to our customers every day.

 

Handover of the golden certificate, November 2025

 

SAP is strongly focusing on the cloud and encourages partners to support customers in their migration journey. Do you plan to further expand your cloud-related services, and how are you already helping customers in this area?

Absolutely! As cloud adoption accelerates, we‚Äôre investing heavily in expertise, solutions, and tooling to help our customers make a safe and successful transition. We guide customers through end-to-end migrations to SAP S/4HANA and RISE with SAP, delivering managed cloud services, including security, monitoring, and seamless integration with our robust network infrastructure. Our unique position as both a connectivity and SAP services provider ensures our customers enjoy secure, future-ready cloud journeys. Looking ahead, we‚Äôre excited to expand our offerings in cloud security and AI-driven automation, empowering our customers to achieve even greater success.

 

You were recently certified for the first time for SAP BTP operations. What experiences have you gained with SAP BTP in recent years, and what motivated you to pursue this certification at this point in your company‚Äôs evolution?

We saw that many of our customers were eager to unlock the full potential of SAP BTP, but often found it challenging to manage the platform‚Äôs complexity, especially around monitoring, security, and operational excellence. By investing in SAP BTP expertise and achieving official certification, we ensure our customers can rely on us for secure, reliable, and optimized BTP operations. This milestone reflects our ambition to stay ahead of technological developments and our commitment to supporting our customers‚Äô innovation journeys. Together, we embrace every step forward in making SAP BTP a powerful asset for our clients.

 

How would you describe your experience with the audits? Do they provide any valuable insights or ideas for further improvement?

We welcome the audit process as a valuable opportunity to reflect, improve, and benchmark our services against the highest standards. While preparing for an audit is demanding, the thoroughness and professionalism of SAP‚Äôs auditors always lead to constructive feedback and fresh ideas. We carefully review every audit report and translate recommendations into concrete actions, ensuring we continuously raise the bar for our customers. These audits not only strengthen our partnership with SAP but also motivate us as a team to take pride in our achievements and strive for continuous improvement.

 

Information on the certification program for operations partners and an overview of all certified partners can be found in the SAP Operations Partner Guide.

Visit OPC at SAP.com or on the SAP Partner Portal.

You can enable the DEBUG log level for Wizard to display its performance tracing information in the AndroidWizard-plugin.log file. To do this, follow these steps:

entry.title: Re: 'Starting new task' process is not send to sp01
entry.content:
I guess you mean you are using Batch Input ("Call Transaction Using").

In general, a spool request can be generated if you call an RFC-enabled function (via Starting New Task or whatever) and Call Transaction Using.

In your case, I don't know why the spool request is not generated. Don't forget to catch all errors (in Batch Input, "S" messages can be failures, e.g. S349(00)). You have to debug the standard. NB: the print logic often happens inside the update task, so activate the update debug.

entry.title: Re: Attachments / Folder Permissions
entry.content:
Hi,

the best workaround would be that you set up separate folders for each user in your attachments folder, and then assigning the per user via User Defaults. Next step would be settup up permissions per folder so that each user can read all others, and only modify his own. In this way you have users who can upload attachments, but cannot modify other peoples documents.

BR,

Matija

entry.title: Email Attachment Truncation for Spool Output in Custom Batch Job (ZCP_AP_DAILY_BP****
entry.content:
Hello Expert,
please provide your inputs.

Description:

We have a custom batch job ZCP_AP_DAILY_**** that sends daily Business Partner (BP) changes to the C&P Governance team via email. Recently, the Governance team reported that certain BP data changes are missing from the reports they receive.

Issue Observed:

  • Upon testing in the Q40 environment, we found that when the spool output exceeds approximately 100 pages, the email attachment only contains data equivalent to around 16 pages.(1000lines)
  • This appears to be a limitation in how the spool is processed or converted for email delivery.

Analysis Done:

  • Checked with the Development team, and they confirmed that the issue is due to the spool-to-email conversion process.

entry.title: Re: Adobe forms: num.currency{} not working in test envir...
entry.content:
Output of the display pattern: num.currency{} depends on the locale that is used for rendering.
Locale can be hardcoded into the template or set dynamically.
You cannot set the currency symbol manually to this pattern, the currency symbol is automatically determined based on the locale.

In your case I assume that the test report is setting the locale to en_US or a not supported one (which will fallback to en_US).

Locale is passed to the print process via the FM, that is retrieved with: FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME.
Have a look at the fields: LANGU / COUNTRY of structure: SFPDOCPARAMS

Best regards
Pascal

entry.title: Enhancing Safety and Efficiency ‚Äì How SAP S/4HANA Transforms Dangerous Goods Management
entry.content:
Managing dangerous goods in today‚Äôs global supply chains is not only about meeting regulations, it plays a key role in keeping people safe and protecting the environment while also making sure business operations keep running smoothly. Manual processes or disconnected systems can quickly lead to delays, mistakes, and unnecessary risks.

SAP S/4HANA for Product Compliance and its Dangerous Goods Management capabilities can close this gap. By simplifying and automating dangerous goods processes instead of relying on spreadsheets or outdated information, companies can handle their dangerous goods confidently and efficiently without slowing down their operations. Product Compliance comes with embedded regulatory content like UN classifications, hazard labels, shipping names, and transport permissions. So, with that, products can be classified correctly and handled safely throughout the entire supply chain.

What for me really stands out is the integration into everyday business processes. The system automatically calculates and checks transport permissions and flags missing or incomplete classification data. This stops non-compliant shipments before the products leave the warehouse. With built-in analytics, teams can gain a clear overview of regulatory requirements, which makes it much easier to act proactively.

What the video is about:

  • How SAP S/4HANA simplifies classification and global transport management for dangerous goods
  • How embedded regulatory content supports safety and compliance
  • How automated checks and documentation reduce errors, delays, and manual work
  • How analytics provide transparency across the supply chain

This topic is specially close to me because safety and compliance belong together. When they‚Äôre built into daily processes and supported by automation, they don‚Äôt slow teams down. They actually make work easier while reducing risks and building trust across the organization and beyond.

SAP Video - In brief: SAP Product Compliance - Dangerous Goods

Watch the video to see how SAP S/4HANA for Product Compliance can help your organization handle dangerous goods safely and turn regulatory requirements into a real advantage.

entry.title: Filtering records based on measure value when copying data via Data Action in SAC
entry.content:
Dear Community
I have a planning model in SAC called Merge, which is built by merging data from many planning models, one of them is a model called HR (containing employee information).

Currently, I use Data Actions to copy data from the source models into the Merge model. For the HR model, the data is loaded via an Upload Job (every month) and then transferred to the Merge model using a Data Action.

However, in the Merge model I only need employee records where the measure IST is not null / not equal to 0. 
Therefore, when copying data from the HR model into the Merge model, all records where IST = 0 should be excluded. In other planning scenarios I need all data in HR model, so I cannot simply delete it at source.

All involved models share two public dimensions: Cost Center and Company Code.

The challenge is that when copying data from one model to another via a Data Action, filters can only be applied to dimensions, not to measures (at lest to my knowledge). Unfortunately, I don‚Äôt see a way to create a calculated dimension in the planning model that could be used for filtering (for example: if IST = 0 then Exclude = X).

I already tried the following workaround:

  • Create an intermediate model (HR_NEW) using a Data Action:

  • First, copy the relevant data from the HR model
  • Then, delete the records where IST = 0:
    IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "IST") = 0 THEN
    DELETE()
    ENDIF
  • Use this intermediate model (HR_NEW) as the data source for the Merge model

This solution works only as long as the intermediate model has no public dimensions, which makes it unusable in my case.

Does anyone have an idea how these HR data (excluding IST = 0) could be transferred correctly into the Merge model?

Thanks in advance for any suggestions!
Wiola

@N1kh1l @Chris1973

entry.title: Bulk Download Of Payslips - SAP Payroll
entry.content:
Introduction :

Ever Wondered if there was a Way to download Payslips of Employees in Bulk? Well, It is Possible with Spool Requests. Compensation Team always find difficult to download Payslips of employees one by one for Backup /Audit Requirements.

Here's the Breakdown of Configurations to achieve this!

 Access the Transaction HRFORMS and Choose the Custom / Standard Pay slip that is being Used

Double Click on the Form and open in Change Mode

Click on the Selection Screen Tab and Check the Number of Employees per Form and Save and Activate the Form

On the Top Left Corner , Click Form -> Print Program (Test)

Specify the Number of Employees You want to be downloaded in Bulk in One form and Save as Variant

Access the Transaction PC00_M99_CEDT_MULTIP

Choose the Payroll Area , Payroll Period and navigate to the Report and Variant

 

Choose HRFORMS

Enter your Country Grouping , Form Name and Variant

Before Executing the Creation of Payslips , Make sure the User does not have default output device set as LP01 and Print Now should be Disabled.

The Bulk Payslip should be created as a Spool Request which can be viewed from SP02.

View the Spool Request from SP02 and Click on Overall View on , All the Payslips will merged into One File and it can be downloaded.

Pro Tip :

You can split the PDF and rename it with Employee ID - Employee Name by using Third-Party Tool Sejda.

Conclusion:

The Following Configuration was done as a part of requirement from one of the leading banks in Bahrain and Client was super happy about the Bulk Download of Payslips and with Sejda things have got even better where they were able to save it using ID - Name with just a click of a Button. Features like this really improve the operational efficiency and saves a lot of time and Man Power.

entry.title: Re: Step-by-Step Guide to Data Migration Cockpit in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
@alex_alf 
it always depends on the complexity of an object template (number of sheets and fields that you must fill out), the number of records and the number of systems you need to import this. The more fields you need to enter and the more systems you need to import that data, the more it make sense to enter this within the migration template and then upload the data.

As cost and profit center are from low complexity it is probably faster to enter the single cost center and profit center manually instead of filling the template and then upload them via the cockpit. We internally say that for business objects with less than 20 instances per migration into a system, it makes no sense to create a migration object as the effort to create an object is much much higher, than entering the data manually.
Hope that helps.

BR
Frank

P.S. It is better to ask such questions in Q&A area and not as a comment within a blog.

entry.title: Uwaga, uwaga! SAP Business Network supports your e-invoicing compliance in Poland
entry.content:
Countries around the globe are steadily moving towards mandatory e‚Äëinvoicing. As we head into 2026, multiple new mandates are set to roll out. Poland is among the next in line: the mandate becomes effective in February 2026 for large companies and in April 2026 for medium to small companies (excluding microbusinesses). The mandate requires them to issue, send, and receive domestic electronic invoices in the country format FA3_VAT. The invoices need to be digitally signed by the suppliers, timestamped by the KSeF‚Äã tax portal, and need to be stored for a minimum of 10 years. The invoice mandate applies to all VAT established companies in Poland‚Äã.

SAP Business Network's strategy commits to remaining compliant in countries rolling out e-invoicing regulations. For Poland, the details of the technical setup and the configurations steps are listed in below checklist.

Your checklist as a supplier on SAP Business Network

SAP Business Network will facilitate compliance by converting invoices to the mandated format and clearing them with the tax portal, reducing errors and speeding up processing and payments. This means that trading partners on SAP Business Network can continue to use the portal (PO Flip) and their integrated solutions in compliance with Poland's e-invoicing requirements.

Suppliers must configure their country settings on their SAP Business Network account and ensure their customers can receive tax invoice documents in the required format:

  1. Create you Country Configuration on SAP Business Network and provide the required information. This is necessary to clear the invoice with KSeF Portal on behalf of the supplier. Detailed instructions can be found in this guide. 
  2. Verify if your customer has enabled the rule ‚ÄúRequire suppliers to send tax invoice documents‚Äù for Poland, ensuring your invoices are issued in the required FA3_VAT format. ‚ÄãThe trading partner guide shows you where you can check for the activation on this rule.
  3. All Integrated suppliers are required to include mandatory tax exemption details for zero value VAT entries. ‚Äã
  4. The legal invoice needs to be archived for at least 10 years by both buyer and the supplier. Using SAP Business Network long term archiving is optional, you can use the archiving solution of your choice. For more information on SAP Business Network‚Äôs long-term archiving options, click here.

In addition to the guide, we encourage your to access the on-demand webcast for more details to support you in your invoicing journey, including downloadable resources: Replay: SAP Business Network - Support of the Invoice Mandate in Poland

To keep exploring our response to e-invoicing mandates as well as other resources on maximizing your account usage, head over to our SAP Community page.

entry.title: Re: Fetching deleted records in Integration center
entry.content:
Hi rezadwi

  1. In MDF, make the standard field mdfSystemStatus editable.
  2. In Dependents, create a custom field named status with values Active/Inactive.
  3. Configure a business rule in Dependents so that instead of deleting a record, its status is set to Inactive.
  4. In Integration Center (IC), map:
    • The status field in Dependents
    • The mdfSystemStatus field in MDF
      This ensures that records are marked as Inactive rather than deleted.
